common

Interface Metadata<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of metadata directory stored
    All Superinterfaces:
    BaseMetadata, java.lang.Iterable<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MetadataPNG, MetadataPNG2, MetadataTIF

    public interface Metadata<T>
extends BaseMetadata, java.lang.Iterable<T>
    Represents a generic metadata container capable of storing and managing directory elements of type T.

    This interface provides a simplified abstraction for working with metadata structures across different image formats, including PNG, TIFF, JPEG, etc. It includes common operations such as checking for metadata presence, adding directories, and producing debug-friendly output. Support for use by both composite and leaf-style metadata implementations.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Method Detail

      • addDirectory

        void addDirectory(T directory)
        Adds a metadata directory to this container.
        Parameters:
        directory - the metadata directory to add, must not be null

      • getDirectory

        <U> T getDirectory(U component)
        Retrieves a metadata directory that matches the provided component descriptor.

        This method supports multiple forms of lookup depending on the implementation, such as:

        • Tag-based lookup (for example, Taggable, TextKeyword)
        • Directory identifier (for example, DirectoryIdentifier)
        • Type-based or instance-based queries
        Type Parameters:
        U - the type of the component used as a lookup key
        Parameters:
        component - the lookup reference or identifying element
        Returns:
        the matching directory, or null if no match is found

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if the container holds no metadata directories.
        Returns:
        true if empty, otherwise false

      • hasMetadata

        boolean hasMetadata()
        Checks if the container holds any metadata.
        Returns:
        true if any directory is present, otherwise false

      • hasExifData

        boolean hasExifData()
        Determines whether this container holds any Exif metadata via TIFF/IFD structures.
        Returns:
        true if Exif data is available, otherwise false
